info.name: test-2-CRM API
info.description:
# üó£Ô∏è Get started here

This collection template is a blueprint demonstrating the core features of a CRM API. It supports managing accounts, contacts, opportunities, sales activities, and the relations between all of these entities.

## üîñ How to use this template?

#### Step 1: Send the requests

Send the requests and view the response returned by the mock API, or check out the examples included.

#### **Step 2: Update the base URL**

Select the collection and navigate to the Variables tab. Update the `base_url` variable with your API's URL.

#### **Step 3: Customize the requests**

Update the different requests to suit your use case, including the request body, authorization, documentation, headers, tests, and path parameters.

#### **Step 4: Continue building the collection**

Create requests in this collection to test the new API endpoints you develop.

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Resources

[Building requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/)  
[Authorizing requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/)  
[Using variables](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/)  
[Creating your first collection](https://learning.postman.com/docs/getting-started/creating-the-first-collection/)

item.name: Contacts
item.description: A contact is a connection to an account, typically an individual working within the business an account represents.

item.name: Leads

response.name: Successful response
response.body:
{
    "id": "klm654",
    "name": "Bobby Tables",
    "contact_info": "bobby.t@example.com",
    "source": "PERSONAL",
    "status": "UNQUALIFIED",
    "notes": "Jen noted that Bobby's company may be interested in our services."
}

body.raw:

    "name": "Bobby Tables",
    "contact_info": "bobby.t@example.com",
    "source": "PERSONAL",
    "status": "UNQUALIFIED",
    "notes": "Jen noted that Bobby's company may be interested in our services, potential for a new account with Bobby Inc Ltd."
}

response.name: Lead created successfully
response.body:
{
    "id": "klm654",
    "name": "Bobby Tables",
    "contact_info": "bobby.t@example.com",
    "source": "PERSONAL",
    "status": "UNQUALIFIED",

}

item.description:
A lead is a currently-unqualified person or company which may be turned into a contact, account, or opportunity.

When converting a lead to another type, for example contact, you will need to collect additional details such as phone and email. You could do this through your application's interface and submit to the "Create contact" endpoint.

item.name: Opportunities and deals

request.description: Update an existing opportunity, for example to progress its status after a recent activity. One example shows using this to progress the deal to a "Close" status, which automatically adds a `close_date` property to the opportunity/deal.
Retrieve a list of opportunities, optionally filtered e.g. by associated account.

item.description: An opportunity is an individual business opportunity. It relates to an account, but potentially also a contact within an account.

item.name: Activities

response.name: List all activities

item.description: An activity is any sales activity associated with an account, such as an in-person meeting, phone call, or email. The type of activity can be recorded, as well as more detailed notes.

item.name: Accounts
item.description: Accounts are the organizations you're working with. All other data (contacts, activities, opportunities) relate back to an account.
